title: What happens when you pair two phones with Bluetooth? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is how it works: Your headset paired and connected to both phones at the same time; it is listening to both signals, the first speaker goes on, the headset will switch you to that phone; in this case the first phone rings, you will switch to that phone.Now you are talking with first caller, the second phone rings. Depending on your headset multi-point version (basic or advanced) one of following cases happens:Basic Multi-Point: The headset will switch you to second call and your first call will dropAdvanced Multi-Point: The headset will switch you to the second call and put your first call on-hold. Optionally you can add the second call to existing call and actually have a conference call NikooPlaer: The only music player app with binaural 3D sound effect

It depends on the phone. sometimes they can exchange files. Sometimes, one phone can act as the speaker/mic for another. (I used to do this with my first phone that had BT, back in 2003 or so.) it all depends on which profiles the phones expose as a client and as a server.
If your device support you can pair on 4 devices nothing special 2 may receive only call audio and the other 2 will be with media or you call also manually manage services which you want to allow.
